channel.title: 华尔街日报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Recent flooding in cities around the world has overwhelmed transit systems and highlighted vulnerabilities in metropolitan infrastructure #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/WmKh6eOS5a

For the Tokyo Olympics, the German gymnastics team chose unitards over leotards, while Norwegian beach handball players recently rejected bikini bottoms in favor of shorts. Will female athletes change the status quo? https://t.co/nRNY1gYfAe
Satellite imagery appeared to show China building a new network of silos for launching nuclear missiles, a U.S. think tank said https://t.co/o51O4To8GY
When the pandemic closed pools in March 2020, one man opened his backyard pool to Katie Ledecky to let her keep chasing her Olympic dream https://t.co/wnweuhcv0J
Workers are burned out. Is a four-day week the cure? https://t.co/o8xQ7lDBvG

Anna Kiesenhofer’s name did not appear on any list of pre-race favorites, writes @jasongay, but the Austrian mathematician managed to outduel a Dutch superteam and win Olympic gold https://t.co/X0PvyGjrDN
The U.S. loves solar power, but the panels are made using Chinese coal. Governments and companies are looking for emissions cuts at the source. https://t.co/3aYz8hUzdJ
A recent analysis found that one in four hospital workers with direct contact with patients was not vaccinated against Covid-19 https://t.co/2dYn1W4SB6
French protesters took to the streets for the third consecutive Saturday to protest new restrictions on people unvaccinated against Covid-19 https://t.co/tJLKL4JGpz

For the Tokyo Olympics, the German gymnastics team chose unitards over leotards, while Norwegian beach handball players recently rejected bikini bottoms in favor of shorts. Will female athletes change the status quo? https://t.co/GiHWSF1A9g
The real problem with artificial intelligence, writes tech columnist @mims: It’s not actually intelligent. https://t.co/jGbyHJnUDW

Why is Scarlett Johansson suing Disney? Her lawsuit over the streaming release of "Black Widow" doesn't specify the amount she is seeking, but Disney's move is projected to have cost the actress over $50 million, a person familiar with her contract claimed https://t.co/21iUtWP0Hq
What makes the Delta variant so dangerous for unvaccinated people https://t.co/jKVDtRXmlT

From @WSJopinion: No one should expect the CCP to cooperate with a real inquiry into the origins of Covid-19. More disappointing is the lack of candor from American scientists and officials whose conflicts of interest deserve more scrutiny. https://t.co/PIwKWIIZHa
The unlikely baseball star of the Tokyo Games is a slow-moving vehicle that ferries pitchers to the mound in a giant baseball mitt. https://t.co/EWDZ7oIlPB
Amazon was fined about $887 million by an EU privacy regulator for violations related to its advertising https://t.co/Yao8PNtaHQ

A regulatory crackdown by Beijing wiped some $400 billion off the value of U.S.-listed Chinese companies this month. Now, some investors are asking whether China Inc. is worth the risk. https://t.co/vHWU0SmTaR
The real problem with artificial intelligence, writes tech columnist @mims: It’s not actually intelligent. https://t.co/s45JxftzhV
A handwritten note from Trump's call with top DOJ officials: "Just say that the election was corrupt + leave the rest to me and the R. Congressmen" https://t.co/swRxuIawjW

A regulatory crackdown by Beijing wiped some $400 billion off the value of U.S.-listed Chinese companies this month. Now, some investors are asking whether China Inc. is worth the risk. https://t.co/DLoRds1Zs1
Workers are burned out. Is a four-day week the cure? https://t.co/VUzHInmiRM

The former Colombian soldiers jailed in Haiti in the assassination of President Jovenel Moïse said they didn’t kill him and thought they were on a DEA mission to arrest the leader https://t.co/4SOuCuD4KZ
Loch Ness braces for the death of its most famous tourist attraction: What if Nessie isn’t real? https://t.co/4ob0sKr6GI

Refusing a Covid-19 vaccine in South Africa could now drive up your life-insurance premium similar to other risk factors such as smoking, a South African insurer said this week, in a move that is likely to be watched closely by other industry players https://t.co/HfBv85JDE4
The Ever Given, stuck for days in Suez and now in Rotterdam, is drawing tourists. $13 tickets to ride a ferry boat past the 1,300-foot vessel are sold out through Sunday. https://t.co/Tl0FxHHu25

A former Obama administration official who criticized Trump-era immigration policies was confirmed by the Senate on Friday as the director of the nation’s legal-immigration agency https://t.co/gtIAAenBBo

The Biden administration sued Texas on Friday, saying an order from its governor banning the transportation of migrants within the state by anyone other than law enforcement impinges on the federal government’s exclusive control over immigration matters https://t.co/sF9vyGM3x0

From @WSJopinion: I lost my husband to Covid just two weeks before Moderna’s vaccine became available. My prayer is that not one more person dies from this virus. I encourage Americans to get their vaccine before it’s too late, writes Rep. @jbletlow. https://t.co/x4DkYYfXmx
Loch Ness braces for the death of its most famous tourist attraction: What if Nessie isn’t real? https://t.co/tsgyaF5V7z

Hong Kong police arrested a 40-year-old man on suspicion of insulting the Chinese national anthem after videos circulated online of people waving a colonial Hong Kong flag and booing when the song played during an Olympics ceremony, police said https://t.co/qbm0uS2fJO
Vaccinated people infected with the Delta variant may spread the virus, the CDC said, citing a recent outbreak that prompted its new guidance on mask wearing https://t.co/pZIOPP1tWV
A handwritten note from Trump's call with top DOJ officials: "Just say that the election was corrupt + leave the rest to me and the R. Congressmen" https://t.co/vFC1J1VeGg
After staggering through group-stage play, the U.S. women's soccer team beat the Netherlands in a penalty-kick shootout to advance to the semifinals at the Tokyo Olympics https://t.co/bsib0WFGCq

Health experts predict the number of "breakthrough" cases of Covid-19 will rise, but they say these cases also illustrate the strength of the vaccines, by protecting most people against grave illness https://t.co/hBagFEmaFf

The head of the players association for the U.S. men’s soccer team said that the U.S. women’s team should be paid the same as or more than the men, according to an amicus brief filed on Friday in support of the women’s equal-pay lawsuit appeal https://t.co/wxcqIPG65l

The price of Arabica beans is rising as a cold snap strikes Brazil, the world’s biggest coffee producer, and threatens to drive up costs at cafes and breakfast tables around the world #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/PGFUL1l2fh

The Delta variant now accounts for the vast majority of Covid-19 cases in the U.S. Here's a look at the unique combination of mutations that has led to this more infectious version of the coronavirus, prompting revised mask guidelines. https://t.co/vd7LjixtsP
A day after grabbing the most coveted crown in women’s gymnastics, Sunisa Lee is adamant about one thing: she is going to Auburn University in the fall https://t.co/qde5pxcwG4
The dino nugget craze has spawned new shapes. But first, makers had to perfect Baby Yoda's ears. https://t.co/yq1D62nmKh
Scarlett Johansson’s suit against Disney could be a bellwether for the entertainment industry, as media giants prioritize streaming services in pursuit of growth #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/EUKs8BlfWZ
Novak Djokovic lost in the men’s tennis semifinals in Tokyo, ending his bid to win Olympic gold and all four Grand Slam titles in the same year https://t.co/nJdbVUQ8sU
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/dsSenTw8yq
The first plane carrying more than 200 Afghan interpreters and their families departed for the U.S., beginning a major evacuation effort https://t.co/XGke9eMOyC
A Hong Kong protester who was the first to be charged under a national-security law imposed by Beijing was sentenced to nine years in prison https://t.co/1qB6ZESKVS

Billie Eilish’s new album, “Happier Than Ever,” is here, setting up an important test of the 19-year-old artist’s commercial and critical appeal after her four-times-platinum debut in 2019 https://t.co/ZemudfrVMb

Scarlett Johansson is suing Disney over the streaming release of “Black Widow,” saying it breached her contract. The decision to release the film on Disney+ is projected to have cost Johansson more than $50 million, a person familiar claimed. https://t.co/Nk63wSahDw

As the highly transmissible Delta variant spreads, more vaccinated Americans are reporting they have tested positive for Covid-19. Here’s what you need to know about these so-called "breakthrough" cases. https://t.co/QAHjtRB5SL
The Biden administration threatened to sue Texas over an order from its governor banning the transportation of migrants within the state by anyone other than law enforcement https://t.co/iYIZKBZWhB
Instead of trying to change China, Western governments are now beginning to copy it, starting with an embrace of state-driven investment https://t.co/GjQp3VebmE
From @WSJopinion: Shutting down schools was among the most destructive policies of the pandemic, and a new report by McKinsey & Co. quantifies the harm https://t.co/yl8fdJxk5W
